meta.title: LinkedOut
meta.subtitle: Berlin strategic contacts
meta.description: A factual reference for Berlin's geopolitical, investigative, and strategic advisory network.
meta.footer: We acknowledge this resource is built on the ancestral land of DARPA: ARPANET.

organizations.name: Forensis
organizations.description: Berlin-based sister agency of Forensic Architecture. Founded 2021. Specializes in spatial forensics, 3D reconstruction, and counter-investigations using 'open verification' methodologies. Part of the Investigative Commons.
organizations.focus: Spatial forensics, colonial reparations, state/corporate violence accountability

notes.title: High OPSEC Environment
notes.content: 'The Fridge' is a digital-free room within the Forensis office, strictly excluded from all digital equipment to prevent electronic eavesdropping and spyware like NSO's Pegasus.

keyWork.title: German Colonial Genocide in Namibia
keyWork.description: Quantified enduring environmental degradation of Indigenous lands through 3D reconstruction.

keyWork.title: 2025 Nakba Day Protests
keyWork.description: Video analysis disproved official police narratives regarding officer injuries.

people.name: Eyal Weizman
people.background: Founder of Forensic Architecture. Professor of Spatial and Visual Cultures at Goldsmiths, University of London. Developed 'Hollow Land' theory and 'forensic aesthetics' methodology. Primary base: East London and Berlin.

people.name: Robert Trafford
people.background: British journalist specializing in OSINT research. Lead investigator on Pylos shipwreck and Hanau shootings. Research management expertise.

people.name: Dimitra Andritsou

organizations.name: Forensic Architecture
organizations.description: Research agency based at Goldsmiths, University of London. Uses architectural and spatial analysis to investigate human rights violations. Produces evidence for courts, tribunals, and truth commissions. Founded by Eyal Weizman.

people.name: Samaneh Moafi
people.background: Leads 'Cloud Studies' project. Expert in border environment research and environmental violence.

people.name: Nicholas Masterton

organizations.name: ECCHR
organizations.fullName: European Center for Constitutional and Human Rights
organizations.description: Strategic litigation organization using universal jurisdiction to prosecute international crimes. Founded 2007 by Wolfgang Kaleck. Legal backbone for Investigative Commons. Operates Institute for Legal Intervention. Represents Edward Snowden.
organizations.focus: Border Justice, Climate Justice, Business and Human Rights, International Crimes

notes.title: Physical Proximity to Investigative Commons
notes.content: ECCHR's location at Zossener Str. places it in direct physical proximity to Forensis, facilitating seamless transition between evidentiary production and legal filing. This courtyard acts as the intellectual infrastructure for rights-based accountability.

people.name: Wolfgang Kaleck
people.background: Criminal attorney. Founded ECCHR in 2007. Represents Edward Snowden. Known for fearless pursuit of universal jurisdiction cases using the German Code of Crimes against International Law.

people.name: Miriam Saage-Maaß

organizations.name: Tactical Tech
organizations.description: International NGO at the intersection of technology and activism. Runs 'Exposing the Invisible' investigations training and 'The Glass Room' public interventions. Founded 2003. Focus on digital literacy and data ethics for vulnerable communities.

notes.title: Digital Security Protocol
notes.content: Tactical Tech prioritizes digital security. The organization obscures individual emails in favor of project-specific PGP-keyed addresses. Staff at The Glass Room are referred to as 'Ingeniuses.'
